subject: Education
title: Endangered Alphabets: Scripts on the Brink
description: A fast breakdown of Endangered Alphabets: Scripts on the Brink for builders.

hook.text: Every two weeks, a language dies. With it, a writing system may vanish forever from human memory.

buildup.text: Globalization pushes communities toward dominant scripts like Latin, Arabic, and Devanagari.

discovery.text: Linguists estimate that over 100 writing systems are endangeredâ€”used by fewer and fewer people.

twist.text: Some communities are fighting back, teaching children ancestral scripts alongside dominant ones.

climax.text: The Endangered Alphabets Project documents and preserves scripts before they disappear forever.

punchline.text: When an alphabet dies, a way of seeing the world dies with it.

quiz.question: What causes writing systems to become endangered?
options: Globalization pushes communities toward dominant scripts
People choose to stop writing entirely
